org.chathamrobotics.ftcutils

Class OmniWheelDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.chathamrobotics.ftcutils.OmniWheelDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Driver

    public class OmniWheelDriver
extends java.lang.Object
implements Driver
    Driver to control a omniwheel drive setup

      • OmniWheelDriver

        public OmniWheelDriver(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor frontLeft,
                       com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor frontRight,

                       com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor backRight,
                       RobotLogger logger)
        Creates an instance of OmniWheelDriver.
        Parameters:
        frontLeft - The motor located in the front left corner of the robot.
        frontRight - The motor located in the front right corner of the robot.
        backLeft - The motor located in the back left corner of the robot.
        backRight - The motor located in the back right corner of the robot.
        logger - The logger used to debugging values.

        public static OmniWheelDriver build(com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.OpMode opMode)

        Parameters:
        opMode - Used to get all of the necessary components.
        Returns:
        The built OmniWheelDriver.

      • build

        public static OmniWheelDriver build(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hardwareMap,
                                    RobotLogger logger)
        Builds a new OmniWheelDriver using the default motor names (FrontLeft, FrontRight, BackLeft and BackRight).
        Parameters:
        hardwareMap - Used to get all of the motors.
        logger - The logger for used for debugging values.
        Returns:
        The built OmniWheelDriver.

      • build

        public static OmniWheelDriver build(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hardwareMap,
                                    org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.Telemetry telemetry)
        Builds a new OmniWheelDriver using the default motor names (FrontLeft, FrontRight, BackLeft and BackRight).
        Parameters:
        hardwareMap - Used to get all of the required motors.
        telemetry - Used to build the logger.
        Returns:
        The built OmniWheelDriver.

      • setOffsetAngle

        public void setOffsetAngle(double angle)
        Sets the offset angle. The offset angle is used to change what is referenced as the front. It is recommended that only FRONT_OFFSET, LEFT_OFFSET, RIGHT_OFFSET and BACK_OFFSET are used
        Parameters:
        angle - The offset angle to use.

      • setSilent

        public void setSilent(boolean silent)
        Sets silent. Whether or not to output debugging values. true for no logging and false for logging.
        Parameters:
        silent - Whether or not be silent.

      • setFloatBehavior

        public void setFloatBehavior(boolean useFloat)
        Sets the zero behavior of the drive motors to float or brake. Float behavior makes the changes in motor speed more gradual. This is especially useful when a lift is raised.
        Parameters:
        useFloat - Whether or not to use float behavior.

      • driveWithControls

        public void driveWithControls(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad gp)
        Uses the default controls and the gamepad values to drive the robot. Default controls: - The left joystick controls the movement. The robot will travel in the direction of the joystick. - The right joystick x direction controls the rotation of the robot. - The d-pad is used to change which side of the robot is referenced as the front. eg. Pressing the down direction on the d-pad makes the back of the robot the front.
        Parameters:
        gp - The game pad object.

      • drive

        public void drive(double y,
                  double x,
                  double rotation)
        Drives in the direction specified by the given x and y value.
        Parameters:
        y - The Y portion of the direction.
        x - The X portion of the direction.
        rotation - The rotation to perform. Positive for right and negative for left.

      • drive

        public void drive(double y,
                  double x,
                  double rotation,
                  double magnitude)
        Drives in the direction specified by the given x and y value.
        Parameters:
        y - The Y portion of the direction.
        x - The X portion of the direction.
        rotation - The rotation to perform. Positive for right and negative for left.
        magnitude - The magnitude of the motor power.

      • move

        public void move(double direction,
                 double rotation,
                 double magnitude)
        Moves the robot in the direction specified.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction(angle) for the robot to go measured radians.
        rotation - The rotation to perform. Positive for right and negative for left.
        magnitude - The magnitude of the motor power.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the motors controlled by the driver.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Driver
